roleset.name: come back
roleset.note: RETURN-V NOTES: This is probably a different sense (Wordnet has 16 verbal senses forreturn) but the syntax seems to work. Corresponding VN class escape-51.1-2. (from return.01-v)
RETURN-N NOTES: Roleset based on return.02. Verbnet class escape-51.1-2. Framed by Katie. (from return.01-n)

example.name: typical
example.text: I-1 need *trace*-1 to return on Tuesday.

example.name: metaphorical
example.text: Parents are returning to the cloth diaper.

example.name: Example of end point as 'return to ..."
example.text: they expect a return to full operations by Saturday

example.name: Example with arg 1 and 4
example.text: their return to black townships across the country
example.arg: to black townships across the country

example.name: Example with args 0 and 4
example.text: their return to Earth

example.name: Example with arg 1
example.text: The possible return of the verification team

example.name: revert to
example.text: a return to Soviet-era symbolism in Russia

roleset.name: give back
roleset.note: RETURN-V NOTES: Nothing is actually changing hands here, so it's a different sense,but the syntax is the same. (from return.02-v)
RETURN-N NOTES: Roleset based on return.02. Verbnet class send-11.1. Framed by Katie. (from return.02-n)

example.name: Japanese baseball
example.text: Fans politely return foul balls to stadium ushers.

example.name: seeking comment
example.text: Charles LaBella didn't return phone calls seeking comment.

example.name: Example with all args
example.text: his return toast to Mr. Nixon

example.name: Example with args 1 and 2
example.text: the return of cheaper shares to the lender

example.name: Example with all args
example.text: Their return of our refugees to their homes

example.name: Possibly confusing use
example.text: Jack's safe return

example.name: Args 1 and 2
example.text: The return of East Jerusalem to the Palestinians

roleset.name: bring back
roleset.note: RETURN-V NOTES: Syntax is similar to "give back". Corresponding VN class convert-26.6.2. (from return.03-v)
RETURN-N NOTES: Roleset based on return.03. Verbnet class send-11.1. Framed by Katie. (from return.03-n)

role.descr: attribute of arg1, state arg1 is brought back to

example.name: transitive active
example.text: The company had returned the plant to routine inspection in August.

example.name: Example with arg 1
example.text: the best punt return , quarterback sack , etc

example.name: Example with arg 0 and arg 1
example.text: The mechine's ball return was broken.

roleset.name: send back
roleset.note: RETURN-V NOTES: Almost 'cause to come back' and thus closely related to return.01, butnote that you can't have a source argument (at least not to my ears). VN class send-11.1 (from return.04-v)

example.name: all args
example.text: Mr. Koskotas is fighting extradition proceedings that [*T*-2] would return him to Greece, where he is charged with embezzling more than $250 million from the Bank of Crete.
example.arg: to Greece, where he is charged with embezzling more than $250 million from the Bank of Crete

roleset.name: exchange, trade
roleset.note: RETURN-N NOTES: Roleset based on exchange.01. Verbnet class exchange-13.6. Framed by Katie. (from return.05-n)

example.name: Args 1,3
example.text: North Korea agreed to dismantle its nuclear program in return for economic aid.
example.arg: North Korea agreed to dismantle its nuclear program

example.name: Example with args 1
example.text: in return for removing all our tariff barriers
example.arg: for removing all our tariff barriers

example.name: Often in the form of 'in return for'
example.text: In return for services rendered

example.name: It is rare to find this with more than arg 1
example.text: In return for your patience

roleset.name: give a dividend
roleset.note: RETURN-N NOTES: Roleset based on yield.03. No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie. (from return.04-n)

example.name: Monitary example (usual use)
example.text: a 0.89 % return on assets for Security Pacific

example.name: the return percentage can be 'earnings'
example.text: KKR racked up annual returns of 60 % in the three years it owned Storer .

example.name: Non-monitary example
example.text: Returns from just under a third of the polling stations
example.arg: from just under a third of the polling stations

example.name: Arg 0 is often inanimate
example.text: A return of investments of 32%

example.name: Animate arg 2
example.text: whose returns after tax have trailed tuition increases

roleset.name: eligible/able to be given back
roleset.note: RETURNABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. Relation to return.02 (from returnable.02-j)

example.name: arg1
example.text: I ca n't get a fucking answer . If it s returnable , buy it , I guess , but I really do n't see us using it . It supposed to be 70 on Monday . You can always return it .
